New Records: Pelicans transformed into elite three-point shooting squad, draining 18 treys Sunday, a season high
Key Match Events: Trey Murphy III threw down three slams, drained four trifectas, part of his 22-point game
Dejounte Murray notched his first triple-double as a Pelican, finishing with 14 points, 10 rebounds and 12 assists
Post-Match Reflections: CJ McCollum said in his TV walk-of interview, 'I'm just trying to be aggressive. We're in a tough spot from a record standpoint. I'm trying to take advantage of the work I've been putting in. I'm trying to be as aggressive and efficient as possible to help us win.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pelicans built a double-digit first-half lead and were never seriously threatened by Washington after intermission
New Orleans has held its opponent under 100 points this season twice, both were victories
Rookie center Yves Missi had 16, 7, 3 points, rebounds and blocks in his matchup against No. 2 overall pick Alex Sarr of Washington
Others: Trey Murphy III is the rare NBA player with the combination of skills that could allow him to win the dunk contest and the three-point contest on the same Saturday during All-Star weekend
